M1026.name: Privileged Account Management
M1026.desc: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to privileged accounts, including SYSTEM and root.

M1029.name: Remote Data Storage
M1029.desc: Use remote security log and sensitive file storage where access can be controlled better to prevent exposure of intrusion detection log data or sensitive information.

M1018.name: User Account Management
M1018.desc: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to user accounts.

M1013.name: Application Developer Guidance
M1013.desc: This mitigation describes any guidance or training given to developers of applications to avoid introducing security weaknesses that an adversary may be able to take advantage of.

M1015.name: Active Directory Configuration
M1015.desc: Configure Active Directory to prevent use of certain techniques; use SID Filtering, etc.

M1022.name: Restrict File and Directory Permissions
M1022.desc: Restrict access by setting directory and file permissions that are not specific to users or privileged accounts.

M1041.name: Encrypt Sensitive Information
M1041.desc: Protect sensitive information with strong encryption.

M1039.name: Environment Variable Permissions
M1039.desc: Prevent modification of environment variables by unauthorized users and groups.

M1050.name: Exploit Protection
M1050.desc: Use capabilities to detect and block conditions that may lead to or be indicative of a software exploit occurring.

M1025.name: Privileged Process Integrity
M1025.desc: Protect processes with high privileges that can be used to interact with critical system components through use of protected process light, anti-process injection defenses, or other process integrity enforcement measures.
